item.title: Beth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Beth add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Beth add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Beth add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Beth add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Beth add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Beth add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Beth add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Beth add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Beth add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Beth add a quote by Nancy Thayer
item.description: "It's never too late - in fiction or in life - to revise." -- Nancy Thayer

item.title: Beth add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Beth add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Beth add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Beth add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Beth add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Beth add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Beth add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Beth add a quote by David Byrne
item.description: "Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence." -- David Byrne

item.title: Beth add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Beth add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Beth add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Beth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Beth add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?" -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Beth add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Beth add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Beth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Beth add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne
